H0.text: Forest was the ancient environment in the desert area of Arizona where scientists found large areas of fossilized wood.

H1.text: Desert was the ancient environment in this area, indicated by the large areas of fossilized wood found by scientists in Arizona.

H2.text: Glacier is the ancient environment inferred from the large areas of fossilized wood that scientists found in a desert in Arizona.

H3.text: Grasslands were the ancient environment of the Arizona area where scientists found large areas of fossilized wood in a desert, evidence that the region was once grasslands.

A4.text: They are formed when trees are buried rapidly in dry cold or hot environments.

A5.text: The most notable example is the petrified forest in Arizona.
